questions.question: I don't have time to watch the match. I must ................................ the books. I have an exam tomorrow.
questions.description: To hit the books is to study.

questions.question: I am so tired. I think I should hit the .......................................
questions.description: To hit the sack is to go to bed.

questions.question: I really didn't want to go to the party but Mary twisted my .......................................
questions.description: To twist someone's arm is to convince them to do something they were not keen on doing.

questions.question: My best friend stabbed me in the ............................................ when she went on a date with my boyfriend.
questions.description: To stab someone in the back is to hurt someone who is close to us.

questions.question: The train may be late by an hour so sit ................................... and wait.
questions.description: To sit tight is to wait patiently.

questions.question: Peter no longer smokes. He went ................................... turkey a few months ago.
questions.description: To go cold turkey is to stop an addictive behavior suddenly.

questions.question: If you keep coming late to work, you will have to face the ....................................
questions.description: To face the music is to have to accept punishment.

questions.question: Do you know Susie Richardson? 'I am not sure, but that name certainly rings a ..................................................'
questions.description: When something rings a bell, it sounds familiar.

questions.question: I was frustrated, so I went for a swim to blow off ...................................
questions.description: To blow off steam is to do something to get rid of stress.

questions.question: I am not sure when we will move to our new home. Things are still ................................. in the air.
questions.description: When things are up in the air, they are uncertain.

questions.question: Janet is really on the ........................................ She finishes her assignments several days ahead of the due date.
questions.description: When you are on the ball, you are quite prepared for something.

questions.question: Some of the most successful people in the world went from ................................................ to riches.
questions.description: To go from rags to riches is to go from being poor to having a lot of money.
